Message: The user completes the submission of the form
I created an ad and input my billing. What does this warning mean? Is something missing? I only have one ad, do I need a set of them?
The user has uploaded an image of a campaign management interface indicating a warning for "No active ad sets."

Hi Trudy, it sounds like you might be seeing a warning related to your ad setup. Could you please provide more details about the warning message you're seeing? This will help me better understand the issue and guide you accordingly. Also, having just one ad is fine; you don't necessarily need a set of them unless your campaign strategy requires multiple ads.

Thanks for sharing the details, Trudy. The warning 'No active ad sets' means that while you have created an ad, it hasn't been assigned to an active ad set. An ad set is a group of ads that share the same budget, schedule, and targeting options. To resolve this issue, you'll need to create an ad set and assign your ad to it. Here's how you can do it:
1. Go to your Ad Manager.
2. Click on 'Create Ad Set'.
3. Set up your budget, schedule, and targeting options.
4. Assign your existing ad to this new ad set.
For more detailed instructions on creating separate ad accounts and managing them, you can refer to this article: [How to create separate ad accounts](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20333724725133-How-to-create-separate-ad-accounts).
If you need further assistance or have any other questions, feel free to ask!
I did create an ad with an image and everything. How will I know if my first ad here is approved and running?

Hi Trudy, once you've created your ad and assigned it to an active ad set, you can check its status in the Ad Manager. Here's how you can do it:
1. Go to your Ad Manager.
2. Look for the 'Status' column next to your ad.
3. If the status shows 'Approved', your ad is running.
4. If the status shows 'Pending', it means your ad is still under review.
5. If the status shows 'Rejected', there might be an issue with your ad that needs to be addressed.
For more detailed information on creating and managing ads, you can refer to this article: [How to create your first ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad).
If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
ok it says pending
New question

Got it, Trudy. If your ad status is 'Pending', it means it's currently under review by our Ad Operations team. The ad approval process usually takes between 1-2 business days. Sometimes, it can be even quicker.
If your account is new and hasn't been verified yet, this might also cause a delay in the approval process. In that case, you may need to provide additional information for verification. You can email the following details to adsupport@newsbreak.com with the subject line: Business Verification:
- Company's full address
- Company's legal entity name
- Company's EHID or DUNS number
- Primary contact person's name
- Company's phone number
Once we receive this information, we will conduct a thorough review and update you on your account status.
For more details on the ad approval process, you can refer to this article: [How to create your first ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad).
If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
Sure, Trudy! What's your new question? I'm here to help.
Do you take submission articles here? How can I write for this newspaper?

Hi Trudy, thanks for your interest in writing for NewsBreak! We do accept article submissions from contributors. To get started, you can apply to become a NewsBreak contributor by visiting our Contributor Program page. Here are the steps:
1. Go to the NewsBreak Contributor Program page.
2. Fill out the application form with your details and writing samples.
3. Submit your application for review.
Once your application is reviewed and approved, you'll be able to submit articles directly to NewsBreak. If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
I want to run a second ad and my budget is the same as last time but it says budget can't be less than spent??? I do not understand. How do I set the budget for the new ad?

It sounds like you're trying to set a budget for your new ad, but the system is indicating that the budget can't be less than what was spent on your previous ad. To set the budget for your new ad, follow these steps:
1. Access Ad Management.
2. Click 'Create Campaign.'
3. Choose the objective that aligns with your goal, such as brand awareness, website traffic, or app installs. Make sure to hit 'Save and Next.'
4. Select your targeting.
5. Define how long you want your campaign to run.
6. Set your budget (the minimum daily budget is $10).
7. Fill in your creatives by adding a headline, body, image/video, and link to listing.
If you need more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How to create your first ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad). Let me know if you have any other questions!
the ad is a second ad in the same campaign though, not a new campaign

Got it! If you're adding a second ad to the same campaign, you can adjust the budget for the ad set. Here's how you can do it:
1. Navigate to your preferred ad set within the campaign.
2. Find the specific ad set you wish to modify and click 'Edit.'
3. Scroll down to 'Delivery' and adjust your budget as needed.
4. Save your changes.
Remember, during the learning phase, it's suggested not to make too many changes at once, as this can cause fluctuations in performance. It's recommended to increase your budget by no more than 50% every 2-3 days.
For more details on managing your ad budget, you can refer to this article: [NewsBreak Advertising Cost](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17959734533005-NewsBreak-Advertising-Cost). Let me know if you need any further assistance!
how do I add more money so ads run?

You can add more money to your ad campaign by editing the budget of your ad set. Here's how you can do it:
1. Navigate to your preferred ad set.
2. Find the specific ad set you wish to modify and click 'Edit.'
3. Scroll down to 'Delivery' and adjust your budget as needed.
4. Save your changes.
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [NewsBreak Advertising Cost](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17959734533005-NewsBreak-Advertising-Cost).
I do not see delivery. The last thing I can scroll down to is extra tracking options

It sounds like you might be in the wrong section or there might be a display issue. Let's try a couple of things:
1. Make sure you are in the 'Edit' mode of the specific ad set you want to modify.
2. If you still don't see the 'Delivery' section, try refreshing the page or clearing your browser cache.
3. If the issue persists, it might be helpful to contact support for further assistance.
You can reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your issue.
the budget is at $100 the current spend is at $80 but nothing is running

If your ad budget is set at $100 and the current spend is at $80 but nothing is running, there might be a few reasons for this. Here are some steps to troubleshoot the issue:
1. **Check Ad Status**: Ensure that your ad set is active and not paused.
2. **Review Ad Schedule**: Make sure your ads are scheduled to run during the current time period.
3. **Audience Targeting**: Verify that your audience targeting settings are correct and not too restrictive.
4. **Ad Approval**: Confirm that your ad has been approved and is not under review or rejected.
5. **Tracking Issues**: Ensure there are no issues with tracking pixels or postbacks that might be affecting ad delivery.
If you have checked all these factors and still face issues, it might be helpful to contact support for further assistance. You can reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your issue.
they are active, but ZERO movement in 24 hours versus spiked activity a week ago

If your ads are active but there has been zero movement in the past 24 hours compared to spiked activity a week ago, it could be due to several factors. Here are some steps you can take to troubleshoot and optimize your campaign:
1. **Review Ad Performance**: Check the performance metrics in the Reporting tab to see if there are any noticeable changes or issues.
2. **Budget Adjustments**: During the learning phase, avoid making too many changes as it can cause fluctuations in performance. Increase your budget no more than 50% every 2-3 days.
3. **Ad Creatives**: Ensure that your ad creatives are still relevant and engaging. Consider running A/B tests with different creatives to identify which ones perform best.
4. **Targeting Settings**: Refine your audience targeting to reach the most relevant users and ensure that your targeting settings are not too restrictive.
5. **Ad Scheduling**: Make sure your ads are scheduled to run during peak hours when your target audience is most active.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to these articles:
- [NewsBreak Advertising Cost](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17959734533005-NewsBreak-Advertising-Cost)
- [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing)
If you have checked all these factors and still face issues, it might be helpful to contact support for further assistance. You can reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your issue.
the end time is tomorrow and the $ is not being spent. I will contact the support team

It sounds like there might be an issue with your ad campaign settings. Since the end time is tomorrow and the budget is not being spent, contacting the support team is a good idea. You can reach out to them at adsupport@newsbreak.com with all the details about your issue. They will be able to assist you further and help resolve the problem.
